title: Gadsisar Lake
review: This is a man made lake excavated way back in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh. In a dessert having such big water body is an engineering marvel. The shrine of Amar Sagar and other Jain Temples are also present here. The view in morning or evening is very good.

title: A pretty place
review: It's not a "not miss" site, but if one has extra time, it has pleasant views and is a nice walk from Jaisalmer Fort.

title: go during winter
review: not so beautiful during summers, should go during winter, not so worth during summer, temple at the spot was good

title: A ggod place to see
review: Well worth a visit to see this site with some lovely old buildings surrounding the lake.  In the lake many cat fish which the locals feed.  There is a good view of the fort from here

title: “Peaceful “
review: Well this is situated some 5-8 km away from the city centre .

title: Clean lake for booting
review: A Clean lake for booting. There are many things to explore in and around jaisalmer. It is located around 5-6 km far from Jaisalmer city. One travelling by car from Jodhpur will cross this place before entering Jaisalmer city.

title: Amar Sagar Lake
review: Amar Sagar Lake located just outside Jaisalmer is a nice artificial lake created to store rain water. The shore of the lake has a nice Jain temple along with few old buildings. It is recommended that one visits this lake during sunset as the reflection of the sun setting on the waters of the lake make for a nice backdrop for photo enthusiasts.

title: nice lake
review: amar sagar lake is not in proper jaisalmer but almost 5 miles from city.we went in evening.it was not crowded and very peaceful place.we also enjoyed boating.

title: For sunrise
review: Not my favorite. Well worth for the sunrise. Pédalos boats for rent. Lake very small. You can get there easily with a tic tuc

title: Beautiful palace on bank of this lake
review: This is a beautiful lake. One royal palace is located on the banks of the this lake. Nice view and good place for visit.

title: Almost Dried
review: This lake is situated at a distance of about 5 Km on Sam sand Dunes Road. Amar Sagar Lake is almost dried and Also it was not well maintained. However one can saw Jain temples there which was masterpiece of Art and architecture.

title: Nature beauty
review: The lake is now almost dry due to hot weather and climate change. yet a very nice place to see natures beauty.

title: Man made lake
review: We were taken to see this lake on our tour of the area.  the interesting bit was seeing all the large catfish coming to the surface to feed whatever was being thrown in!

title: Lake at Dawn
review: Worth getting up early for - this large man made lake is picturesque with the mists rolling off the water.

title: Beautiful Jain Temples & Garden
review: A beautiful garden full of trees & flowering plants. Nice place to see and to photograph. Several beautifully carved Jain temple here.

title: Nothinig to see. no meaning to visit
review: This spot is made just for business purpose. To include this into the sam sand dunes package. nothing to see. A normal temple with entry fee, parking fee and camera fee. Do not waste time. There is no lake now. I visited on the month of February 2017. There was not even a drop of water. May be there is something in the month of june/july. But it can not be a lake. Cut it out from your sam sand dunes program if tour operator is charging extra for this

title: Located close to Amar Singh Palace
review: Amar Sagar lake is a lake cum an oasis located close to the Amar Singh Palace.  Staircases from the palace leads to the lake.  Very calm and tranquil lake where you can feed the fish and see a lot of birds. Best time to visit is during the evening hours when you get to hear the chirping of the birds returning to their nest and also enjoy the cool evening breeze.

title: rain water reservoir on the road to Luderwa
review: Just 6 kms on the way to Luderwa is a natural spot developed by Maharawal Amar Singh in the form of a water reservoir in 1688 AD to hold rainwater.

title: Great
review: Great for a tour on a boat or just picnic. Great sunset and shame its kinda dirty because locals do not respect it too much

title: Not worth visiting
review: Located in the compound as Amar Singh Palace now this place is not nicely maintained. There are many wells all damaged

title: A lake in the Desert hard to believe but true.
review: It is a nice place off the Jaisalmer-Sam Sand Dunes Road. Historic architecture and a Beautiful Jain Temple a must visit.

title: Lake is dried up
review: D Temple is beautiful. But d lake is dried up. Beautiful architecture n u get good pics here. Nice place

title: Amar Sagar Lake
review: Amar Sagar Lake is also a very attractive sightseeing place near jaisalmer after gadsisar lake near about 5 km on sam road.

title: Dried up lake but the Jain temple is beautiful
review: The lake has been dry this year due to a poor monsoon season- so we could not appreciate the chatris which look pretty when they are partly submerged in water. There is a Jain temple which is lovely like most jain temples in the area- beautifully carved.

title: A place with boating facility
review: After daytime site seeing we reached the Amar Sagar Lake. It is just a waking distance from main area. Here paddle boats are available on halh hourly basis. During sunset its an best experience. The old construction of stone temples, the quiet surrounding with retreating birds adding to the scene. One should experience this with his/her dear one.

title: No water
review: The lake is dry. Has no water to it. But the place is famous for the movie shooting(Paheli). So if you want you can visit. But there is not much to see.

title: Dry Lake
review: Thought there is no water in the lake, there is a beautiful Jain temple here. Entry to Jain temple is free but you need to pay 50 INR for photography.

title: Natural lake in desert
review: Lake in desert! Very interesting find! I never expected much water around the desert area but so refreshing to find one near Jaisalmer!

title: This place is very badly managed
review: When I visited there, It was dirty, grimy and grubby. There weren't many visitors. May be our timing was not right...

title: Lake with Awesome Views
review: Amar Sagar Lake is situated at a distance of about 7 km towrds the western outskirts of Jaisalmer.The lake is adjacent to Amar Singh Palace.This copmlex of Amar Sagar lake and palace includes various ponds and wells along with an old Shiva temple.

title: Average Jain Temple
review: A jain temple again in Jaiselmer. In jodhour and Jiaselmer , there are lots of Jain temples.

title: Good stopover on way to SAM
review: This may be considered as a good stopover while going towards SAM, Having seen  Jain temples and all beautiful ones, this one would be rated average only. However, the lake is a good one and can be visited for some relaxing time. One may choose to visit it while going towards SAM or coming back from it depending upon time available.

title: Nice Lake in Jaislmer
review: This is good lake in desert. feeling good to see this lake in desert area. this is good area for photography

title: Nice lake
review: The water of this lake never dries as the story goes. Good place to enjoy and relax. In the heat of desert, lake side soothing wind will make u relax.

title: Perfect Destination for chilling
review: Situated in heart of Jaisalmer, here you can enjoy riding of padal boat and you will be feeling cool during summer.

title: Kids Begging Will Ruin Atmosphere
review: Very beautiful lake! You can walk right around it, and very near there are some stalls, an option to ride a pedal-boat for 100 rupees (two people) and also a small cultural museum (entry Rs. 10). Shame about the kids who stalked me around the lake and relentlessly asked me for some rupees.

title: Very Nice place for walk and Boating
review: We enjoyed visiting this place, just walked around and then went for boating, make sure you don't take the boat at the end of lake as there is little water and mud and you can get stuck, there is no problem others will inform and someone will come for rescue but will be time wasting, enjoyed boating and we will be returning soon to this place.If people dont have car local transportation is available to visit any places in Jaisalmer.

title: Lovely
review: We reached at night so we couldn't really make head or tail of the lake. But the surrounding was just lovely. It should be illuminated more so that visitors can at least sit by the lake at night.

title: Switch on your camera
review: You can take some nice photos in this place . Place is very good but you can't spend more than 1hr here . Places around the lake is not clean .

title: peaceful
review: Good place to walk and spend some serene time.. also you can click good pictures there.. you can boat as well.. nice place

title: small lake
review: small man made lake next to a haveli with shiva temple in the complex, on the outskirts of jaisalmer

title: Ok
review: This is 400 years ago lake.but now this lake has not much water.location is good.Jain temple is nearer to this lake.this lake nearer to approx 6km to lodhuvara .I visited 2015.

title: Average
review: It is a small lake which is next to a haveli with shiva temple in the complex. It is 5 Kms from city.

title: Peaceful and green
review: It's a beautiful garden and lake to visit. It has a got a small swimming pool for the royalty as shown by our guide.

title: Well maintained Jain Temple
review: We just dropped in while driving to Sam. Just need to take a small detour. The temple is well maintained. It will be very beautiful if the lake behind the temple is full. Details of the architecture is well preserved. Worth the visit. There is another place Lodurva which we did not got chance to visit, but heard that it is also worth!

title: Nice temple with great lake view..
review: Its on the way from Jaisalmer city to Sam desert.. Very nice Jain temple with great view of lake at the back..

title: Lake in the desert
review: This beautiful lake is on the outskirts, one one shore is the jain temple of the yester years. The temple is an active temple, the major disappointment was Rs 50/- for carrying the mobile phone with camera.

title: a little walk around the lake and feeding the carp from the island
review: It was great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the fort and city by going on a little walk around this lake.

title: Good place
review: The place is nice. you would be allowed to go closer, if you avail the service of boating, else the boat owners wont let you go to the side. the best place to do photography is to go on top.

title: A lovely place to relax!
review: We were lucky to be there at the right time ... and take the boat ride.  the sun was just setting and the whole place became magical.

title: A quiet oasis
review: Situated 5km west of the centre of Jaisalmer, it is a tranquil lake adjacent to Amar Singh Palace with a lot of different birds.  Around this lake are several wells and an old Shiva temple.  People often feed the fish and surprisingly, go boating in this desert lake.

title: Flawless beauty with catfish
review: I was advised to get to the lake early and arrived whilst the morning was cool. The early light gleamed golden in the water as I wandered along the ghats, glancing back at the curvaceous profiles of the structures floating on the water and the colourful pleasure boats clustered nearby.

title: Don't go for the lake!
review: Don't go for the lake, there is a hidden little gem just behind the temple grounds... It's a walk in well that has the clearest and nicest water to swim in! It's great on a hot day to just go and join the locals in jumping off the top into the cooling waters. Don't worry, it's very deep so you won't hit the bottom! Highly recommended

title: a little bit disappointing
review: A pleasant venue for the locals I suppose, but in comparison with the elaborate havelis at the fort, it wasn't of great interest for me personally.

title: Glory of yesterday.
review: This is private property of highness of jaisalmer .5 km from sam road. there is 2 havallies back of the lack where highness family visited & stayed.now a days also they are coming. In the back side there is a garden a lot of peacock freely moving .There is little jem behind the lack where local people come to swim . nice place to see.

title: good feelings
review: Nice lake with representative of the culture of this energetic part of the world... pity that the human spoiled it a little too much...

title: Beautiful place to visit
review: its one of the attractions at jaisalmer where you want to go. not far from city and worth going . MY recommandations

title: I'm not a fan of Anaconda size catfish
review: The lake is a happy enough haven but was short on water due to a poor monsoon and drought pending conditions in Rajahstan. Nevertheless, there was enough for local tourists to hire pedal boats and float around for awhile although the big blue swan design one sat incongruously against the historical sandstone island structures.

title: A natural beauty
review: Good vision by emperors who developed this lake. Worth seeing for its beauty.  Emperors have taken social requirement in to consideration and developed this lake.

title: Lake along with Jain temple
review: Amar Sagar has got a jain temple along with the lake and you get great views of the lake from the temple ramparts. The temple itself has beautiful architecture and also has a small garden around it.

title: Beautiful temple, dry lake
review: The name of this attraction is bit of a misnomer. The lake surrounding the temple is completely dry. It is the temple which is the attraction. Very beautiful carvings. Very peaceful.

title: A lake without water
review: The only thing here to see is the jain temple beside the Amar Sagar lake. But you may get surprised to see that there is no water in the lake. At least when we visited i.e. January, 2015 (winter) there was no water. Nothing much to see unless you are architecture and history buff.

title: Go for the Jain Temple
review: If you are looking for the lake you will be disappointed as it is dry until the next rains come. However there is another beautiful Jain temple to be toured. So go for the Temple not the lake.

title: it is actually a temple
review: it is actually a jain temple but worth visiting atleast once. It has very good mahavir ji statutes. its one the way to sand dunes.

title: Stunning lake
review: Its definitely worth a walk down to the lake if you are staying in the city.

title: Dry Lake - Beautiful Jain Temple
review: The lake here is all dry, but the jain temple is really beautiful. Audio Guide is available. Not many people visit this place, so if you are one the lucky ones visiting this place then you will experience calmness, peace and solitude. This is a 250 year old Jain Temple and well maintained.

title: A clear lake in the desert
review: The lake is definitely a welcome change to the eyes in the Jaiselmer desert. We visited the area in the hot season and the sight of the blue water and cool breeze refresher us. It was heart warming to a lake that was so clean!

title: No lake but Jain Temple
review: The pictures from Olghina_olghina and Skwatr are not from Amar Sagar but from Gadsisar Sagar Lake in Jaisalmer!

title: Nice lake and Temple
review: This lake is definitely worth a walk around. The views are beautiful and it is not visited by many people so it is quiet and nice.

title: no water
review: we say the lake, well people said this is where the lake was. but that is all about that.. nothing else to say.

title: Extremely Poor
review: There was not water and seems like just a village pond. But jain temple is very near to it which is worth visiting

title: Nice for a visit
review: I went there with Don't Complain Travel. The temples are nice, but when I went there in April, there was a dry-spell so they were not within the lake. Still worth the visit, though.

title: Source of happiness and tranquil
review: A simple lake in the middle of this desert town makes one feel good. Boating is an added attraction. View during sunset with the reflections of the chhatris in the lake water is awesome. A must visit while at Jaisalmer

title: Carving in sand stone
review: From Lodarwa, on way to Jaisalmer, there is another Jain temple campus popularly known as Amar Sagar. It is on the bank of lake Amar Sagar.

title: Pani hota to kuchh aur baat hoti.....
review: I like this lake very much..there was not a single drop of water but was very beautiful.. i was just thinking how it would be look like if it is full of water.

title: Beautiful place
review: It is on the way to sam sand dunes. The water is very clean and not a soul around. One can go into the waters.

title: waste of time
review: when i Visit Amar Sagar Lake in oct. no maintenance at all around Lake, very dirty area and not a drop of water . Take Lesson and case study of Kankaria Lake in Ahmedabad and save heritage.don't waste your time by go there

title: visit if u have time
review: a place around 10 kms from the town, the lake was dry and we visited a Jain temple beside it, this is not betterthan the one inside the Jaisalmer fort, can give a miss if shortage of time

title: Beautiful jain temple, exquisite architecture, dry and poorly maintained lake
review: We were going to Desert camp and we visited this temple on the way. This temple has very beautiful architecture and carvings. It is situated on the banks of a lake. The lake is not very scenic as it does not have much water and the place is not very clean. But, we tend to forget everything once we are in the temple. It is that beautiful. A good place to visit in the outskirts of Jaisalmer.

title: Amazing architecture
review: Amar sagar is truly a beautiful Jain temple with amazing architecture. Although the name has Sagar in it, the surrounding water has all dried up, nevertheless if you are in Jaisalmer then do not miss out this spot. You can take beautiful pics inside the premises.

title: Nice place
review: There is a famous Jain Temple at this place with the lake which is almost empty throughout the season. The temple is a good place to see as it is made up of Jaisalmeri stones with a lot of ework done by hand on it.

title: Perfect for a sunset boat ride
review: When in Jaisalmer, do visit this lake in the evening before the sunset.  Rent a boat for an hour, and enjoy the sunset view and reflection in the water, its calm and beautiful. You can carry some munchies or some drinks along but please be mature enough to be discreet about it since locals will object.

title: Lake empty
review: The lake was all dried out when I visited in August.  The Jain temple was however peaceful and un-touristed. 100 rupee charge for foreigners.

title: No Management and Maintenance at al
review: Visit Amar Sagar Lake, no maintenance at all around Lake, very dirty water and boat situation is not good, riding is very dangerous. Take Lesson and case study of Kankaria Lake in Ahmedabad and save heritage.

title: jain temple at Amar Sagar lake
review: Lake is almost dried. it still has water in Bavdis ( special type of open wales)

title: Could not locate the lake
review: Went to see the lake but it was dried up. A jain temple is located within the place. An average place to visit

title: Nice Architecture, reminiscent of similar monuments/sights in the area
review: Its a peaceful jain temple on the Sam dunes road. Its got a nice architecture and good carvings typical to the temples and other similar monuments in the region.

title: Dry!! but the temples are beautiful
review: The lake is dry but the Jain Temples around are beautiful. Must visit on the way to Sam sand dunes.Would be a sight around monsoons with water in the lake

title: No Lake
review: There is no lake and where lake used to be in past, children play cricket now.

title: Beautiful temples & garden
review: It is a small and beautiful oasis with orchards. It has a beautiful garden full of trees & flowering plants. Nice place to see and to photograph. Several beautifully carved Jain temple here. There is a village on other side of the lake having old Haveli & buildings.This 300 year old Haveli of Jaisalmer's Prime Minister to Maharaja Rawal Gaj Singh Salim Singh, has a beautiful blue cupola roof with superby carved brackets in the form of peacocks. This extraordinary mansion in yellow stone is covered with intricate carvings and has an elaborate projecting balcony on the top storey. The mansion is one of the most notables of the array of havelis

title: Nice lake to see sunset
review: It's nice place not too far from the for so it's walkable...you can see the sunset from here as well as feeding hundreds of catfish that live on the lake

title: A pretty place
review: It's not a "not miss" site, but if one has extra time, it has pleasant views and is a nice walk from Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Gadsisar Lake
review: This is a man made lake excavated way back in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh. In a dessert having such big water body is an engineering marvel. The shrine of Amar Sagar and other Jain Temples are also present here. The view in morning or evening is very good.

title: go during winter
review: not so beautiful during summers, should go during winter, not so worth during summer, temple at the spot was good

title: A ggod place to see
review: Well worth a visit to see this site with some lovely old buildings surrounding the lake.  In the lake many cat fish which the locals feed.  There is a good view of the fort from here

title: Clean lake for booting
review: A Clean lake for booting. There are many things to explore in and around jaisalmer. It is located around 5-6 km far from Jaisalmer city. One travelling by car from Jodhpur will cross this place before entering Jaisalmer city.

title: “Peaceful “
review: Well this is situated some 5-8 km away from the city centre .

title: Amar Sagar Lake
review: Amar Sagar Lake located just outside Jaisalmer is a nice artificial lake created to store rain water. The shore of the lake has a nice Jain temple along with few old buildings. It is recommended that one visits this lake during sunset as the reflection of the sun setting on the waters of the lake make for a nice backdrop for photo enthusiasts.

title: Beautiful palace on bank of this lake
review: This is a beautiful lake. One royal palace is located on the banks of the this lake. Nice view and good place for visit.

title: For sunrise
review: Not my favorite. Well worth for the sunrise. Pédalos boats for rent. Lake very small. You can get there easily with a tic tuc

title: nice lake
review: amar sagar lake is not in proper jaisalmer but almost 5 miles from city.we went in evening.it was not crowded and very peaceful place.we also enjoyed boating.

title: A pretty place
review: It's not a "not miss" site, but if one has extra time, it has pleasant views and is a nice walk from Jaisalmer Fort.

title: Gadsisar Lake
review: This is a man made lake excavated way back in 1367 by Rawal Gadsi Singh. In a dessert having such big water body is an engineering marvel. The shrine of Amar Sagar and other Jain Temples are also present here. The view in morning or evening is very good.

title: go during winter
review: not so beautiful during summers, should go during winter, not so worth during summer, temple at the spot was good

review: Well worth a visit to see this site with some lovely old buildings surrounding the lake.  In the lake many cat fish which the locals feed.  There is a good view of the fort from here

title: “Peaceful “
review: Well this is situated some 5-8 km away from the city centre .

review: A Clean lake for booting. There are many things to explore in and around jaisalmer. It is located around 5-6 km far from Jaisalmer city. One travelling by car from Jodhpur will cross this place before entering Jaisalmer city.

title: nice lake
review: amar sagar lake is not in proper jaisalmer but almost 5 miles from city.we went in evening.it was not crowded and very peaceful place.we also enjoyed boating.

review: Amar Sagar Lake located just outside Jaisalmer is a nice artificial lake created to store rain water. The shore of the lake has a nice Jain temple along with few old buildings. It is recommended that one visits this lake during sunset as the reflection of the sun setting on the waters of the lake make for a nice backdrop for photo enthusiasts.

review: Not my favorite. Well worth for the sunrise. Pédalos boats for rent. Lake very small. You can get there easily with a tic tuc

title: Beautiful palace on bank of this lake
review: This is a beautiful lake. One royal palace is located on the banks of the this lake. Nice view and good place for visit.
